title: Oct. 11 Golf Calendar
text: Oct 10 2015 2:32 pm Upcoming… Oct. 15, Nov. 12: Kiawah Island Golf Resort and First Tee of Greater Charleston’s 6th annual Military Appreciation Golf Clinics, open to active duty military and their children, pre-registration required and rental clubs available, retired military welcome on Nov. 12, hours are 4-5 p.m. on Oct. 15 and Nov. 12, contact Josh Wagaman at josh_wagaman@kiawahresort.com, call (843) 266-4021 or visit kiawahresort.com/golf/military-appreciation-golf. Oct. 16: 17th Annual Berlin G. Myers’“Swinging for Success” Golf Tournament, Pine Forest Country Club, contact Jim Hughes, jhughes@palmettogoodwill.org or visit summervillemayorscommittee.com. Oct. 24: Seventh annual Charleston Elks Lodge 242 Buddy Sirisky Memorial Alzheimer’s Charity Golf Tournament, Oak Point-Kiawah Island Golf Resort, $100 per player or $400 per foursome includes coupon good for one round at Oak Point, contact: Margie Sirisky at (843) 766-3448 or email msirisky@gmail.com or Tommy Sirisky at 843 (224) 7693 or email tsirisky@yahoo.com. Oct. 26-27: Berkeley Senior Invitational, Berkeley Country Club, open to golfers 55 and older by Oct. 26, $100, field limited to 120, call (843) 761-4653. Nov. 9: Seabrook Island Veteran’s Day golf tournament, $120 entry fee for non-Seabrook Island Club members with $50 of each entry fee set aside for Wounded Warrior Project and Ralph Johnson Veteran’s Hospital, call (843) 768-2529 or email golf@discoverseabrook.com. ACES SATURDAY, SEPT. 26 Greg Bridges, Charleston National Golf Club, No. 2, 115 yards. Witnesses: Sally Bridges, Troy Colby, Mike Kauffman. A hole-in-one should be re¬ported by the golf course. Contact Tommy Braswell at (843) 937-5591, fax (843) 937-5579 or email braswell@postandcourier.com. Keywords
